reviews.review_msg: Will not take her class again, really difficult to meet her standards, and I personally think her papers are over cite, basically you have to cite every single setence in your paper which I find it hilarious to do so. I would not consider her as rude, but not the nicest prof.

Dr. Perkins is a great lecturer and makes good points. She's a fair marker. BUT... and this is a huge BUT, she is very rude and condescending. You may feel discouraged to ask her questions in person or even email her because of the way she responds. Rudest professor I've ever had.

Started the take home midterm paper almost 2 weeks prior to the due date, but got the worst mark I have ever gotten in post-secondary. For the whole semester, she basically talked about how no one knew how to write a proper paper and it was disgraceful that not everyone was in upper level writing standards. Do not trust facebook. Avoid her.
Knows what she is teaching, but has very high expectations. Extremely strict, will only give you a decent grade if you meet her expectations perfectly. Would not recommend to anyone.

Dr Perkins is one of the few profs in the crim dept that actually challenges you to think and question your opinions, this is a class where you actually LEARN. Not an auto A: 2 papers, presentation and final exam. But I got an A by showing up and putting in some effort. Perkins has a bad rep for being scary and hard, but she is actually caring.
rude, condesending and unapproachable. doesnt actually like her students in my opinion.

Attendance to lecture is mandatory as she does not post any notes.  Overall, pretty reasonable.  However, she focuses way to much on feminism (which is fine) in moderation.  However, devotes about 80% of the course to it.  Which is a shame, due to the various facets of sociology within law...

Expectations very clear, interesting material, good lecturer, really approachable. I learned a lot in this class & she is probably my favourite prof at SFU so far. Would definitely take another class with her if I could.

Not sure that Karmvir even looks at the work you submit. Doesnt give feedback, and when you ask for it, takes weeks to respond. The feedback provided is random and irrelevant, which leads me to believe that she doesnt actually read you work or take her job as a TA seriously.

This class is extremely hard, she marks very difficult and expects you to do a memo assignment given unclear instructions on how to approach them. I just find the class extremely unfair for what It is especially the teaching style of podcasts separate with slides. Would not take a class with her again as there is very little support.

I took CRIM230 with Dr. Conroy last year and it was very hard but I enjoyed the challenge and managed to get an A. This sem Im taking CRIM332 and my god. I've been working on the first assignment for DAYS and I just keep crying. The instructions make ZERO sense and I think might be impossible to actually do. I am devastated. AVOID and save your GPA

I took Crim 230 with Dr. Conroy last year. It was a hard course but I enjoyed the challenge and ended up with an A in the course. I'm currently taking Crim 332 online, my god. I've been working on the first graded assignment for DAYS and I just keep crying. The instructions make no sense and this is easily the hardest assignment I've ever had to do

She is a really nice person, but HOLY MOLY does she expect a lot from you. I like her feedback, but the feedback she gives is (in my opinion) way too nitpicky and shouldn't call for such a harsh mark. If you are following the rubric, expect to do triple the work because it will never be enough.

Her lectures are her talking in circles and she expects you to come out of it knowing every single detail (even the smallest of ones). The assignments are the most baffling thing about this class. I genuinely don't understand how she and her TA go about marking these assignments. You could literally be answering the question and fail. STAY AWAY!

Her lectures are her talking in circles and she expects you to come out of it knowing everything she went through (even in the smallest of details). Her assignments are the worst. I still don't get how she and her TA come up with the grading of it, you could literally answer the question she's asking and still fail the assignment. Don't take her.

professor Conroy is so confusing, she sucks at everything she does. her lectures are always all over the place. her midterm makes no sense at time because there could be multiple right answers. She needs to get organized before she starts her classes.

everytime i see a class w her i promise not to take it, but i do and regret it every.single.time. don't do it *in nicki minaj's voice*

iris gordon of crim department if im being honest

Repeats herself. Can't make concise lectures yet expects you to write in a concise manner.Talks around in circles good luck understanding what points shes trying to make. Any ratings on here that is above a 1 is Amy rating herself using a burner account.

She is the best prof ever. There are two assignments, one midterm, and a final term paper. She is very detailed, organized, and will help you excel in this class. The final paper has very clear expectations and she helps you a lot. Show up to class and do the readings. The midterm was also very straightforward if you keep up with the readings.

All you are doing is listening and trying to write what she's blabbering about. I wrote the wrong term because she said it only once and that same term was on the test so make sure to really listen clearly. She records her classes otherwise I'm sure everyone would fail. She let us use a cheat sheet for the midterm, yet the average was super low.

Seems like a nice person, but as a professor, she makes it extremely difficult for students to get good marks (And she knows this. Her class average is ALWAYS very low). Even when you've done in-depth work or studying, she is super specific in what she looks for in her assignments and tests. She gives cheat sheets for tests, but doesn't help much.

By far the worst course ive ever taken. Does not care for her students at all. Lacks a clear grading criteria and refuses to show us a grading rubric. Somehow she seems proud of the fact she stresses out all her students and has a class average of %55. Writing to the dean about her because her courses are anything but fair and educational.

Acts like a dictator. Terrible at teaching information. Slides are about as useful as an ashtray on a motorcycle. The class isn't about you learning its about following whatever she says. AVOID AVOID AVOID

I will be fair, she is a very well-structured professor. Her intentions with each test are clear and her assignments are usually straight-forward. BUT those are the only positive things if you are not a Crim major-focused student, you MUST and I mean MUST read every single assigned chapter and extra reading in order to get a decent grade.

Highly recommend Dr. Conroy! Interesting lectures and gave bonus marks at the end of the course! Textbook heavy, but I found she always reviewed testable material in class. Ignore old poor reviews going in. She has clearly reflected on past criticism and improved her course format and her lecturing style. Favourite crim prof yet!

I found Amy placed a lot of emphasis on topics briefly mentioned during lectures that were not covered much in the textbook on exams, which made it difficult to know what to expect. However, the take home exams were relatively easy to do, and the criteria for all the questions was highly descriptive.

One of my favorite profs! Lectures are engaging with interesting, current events and topics. Readings are dry, but the way the assignments are planned out (short, easy in-class midterm, take-home midterm and final) you don't need to memorize the book.

If you come to class and pay attention to the slides, you can easily get an A. She does not ask any trick questions. She literally takes questions word for word from lecture material so just pay attention.

People who criticize her lectures/teaching style expect to be treated like theyre still in high school. If you want to do well, pay attention and take notes. she tells you everything you need to know and doesnt throw curve balls as long as you are proactive about your learning.

She is not that terrible as anecdotes but she is not a good prof either. She mostly focuses on the textbook makes you feel like you are teaching yourself. The materials are interesting but I don't think she teaches the well and trie to help students comprehend. I need a professor to teach me well rather than just throwing a textbook onto my face...

Professor Conroy is one of the best profs to be taught by online. She has adapted better than any other professor I know. She is strict, but clear in her expectations, and doesnt throw you curveballs. You do need to listen to her lectures because the slides dont have much info, so take good notes, and read the text. Shes a reasonable grader :)

Her podcasts are so long yet only 20% of them will be on the exams. There are weekly discussions where you have a group presentation and have to write long paragraphs yet it's only worth 10%. The exams have a one hour time limit and you have to complete many questions within that time frame.

The tutorial is worth 10% and within this tutorial we had to do a group presentation and every single tutorial you basically writing multi paragraph anwsers and it's only worth 10%. The exams are fairly fast paced so you need to know what you are doing or you wont finish and she asks oddly specific questions for the multiple choice.

She rambles so much in her lectures that are podcasts. The midterm exam was 20 short answers and 15 multiple choice questions and she expected all of it to be completed in an hour which is ridiculous. If the short answer questions had one-word answers I wouldn't have cared but they required a decent amount of sentences.

The instructions for assignments are not specific enough at all but you will be graded like as if her high expectations were made clear. Her excuses for taking marks away will not align in any way with the grading criteria.
lectures are posted in podcast form, brief , asynchronous, not the most engaging. Almost get a disinterested feel from Dr. Conroy. Her test's aren't easy either.
Expect low marks with little to no good excuses

Her lecture slides are brief so you will have to come to lectures to pay attention and listen her talk. It is important to attend the lectures because most of the questions on the exams will be from materials she talked about. Pay attention to cases and pictures in her slides cause it is guaranteed she will ask you about those on the exams.

She is hard to follow in lecture, she misspeaks and says things in illogical order. It is easy to get lost and not know what she is talking about because she doesn't explain things naturally. She takes long pauses and then says things very fast so she is hard to understand. Does not offer any extra insight, just talks about course content.

Nicole's class is hard: to get an A, you actually have to do the readings (and take notes on them). You MUST take notes on what she says, her slides are not detailed enough for exams. Paper is worth lots I highly recommend discussing an outline with her. She's really nice and I appreciate that she exposed us different perspectives without bias.

The class was okay. She speaks very slowly and passionately so if you're not interested in the course material you will have a hard time staying awake. Exams were 4/5 vague long answer questions. The readings were all online which was nice.

NOT a GPA booster; you actually have to study for an A. Grading criteria is clear though standard is very high. Encourages questions, very accessible. Exams are essay based. Lecture notes are NOT enough! Must take detailed notes of what she says and the readings!! Talks fast but content is great: offers a variety of arguments for each issue.

cannot stand her class. It's just her rambling on and on about the same stuff she said since minute one for hours on end. She also makes a ton of dramatic pauses over repetition instead of new thought provoking ideas. If anyone ever wonders why sociology is a joke, take her class and you will realize why.
Goes way too fast in lecture. Does not record lectures. Very hard marker. DO NOT TAKE

Dr. Myers is awesome! Have taken a couple classes with her, and she is now one of my favourite Crim profs at SFU.  She is really knowledgeable on the topics discussed in class, and is more than willing to help students out on papers in office hours.  Tests are difficult, but mostly based on stuff discussed in class.  Paper for 332 was tricky.

She's a really great prof. Very approachable, kind, good speaker. I probably wouldn't take her again just because getting a good grade with her is really hard. Definitely makes you work. Had Krystal for a TA. WHATEVER YOU DO NOT TAKE KRYSTAL GLOWATSKI for a TA. I've never gotten a C in my life until Krystal came along. I deserved a better grade
